generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

\(PQ\) corresponds to \(AB\), \(PR\) corresponds to \(AC\) and \(QR\) corresponds to \(BC\).

\(\frac{AB}{PQ} = \frac{AC}{PR} = \frac{BC}{QR} = constant ratio\)

\(\angle QPR = \angle BAC = 55 ^\circ\)

\(\angle PRQ = \angle ACB = 50^\circ\)

\(\angle PQR = \angle ABC = 180^\circ-(75^\circ + 50^\circ)=50^\circ\)

\(\triangle\, PQR\) and \(\triangle \,ABC\) are similar

Thus, \(\frac{AB}{PQ} = \frac{AC}{PR} \Rightarrow \) \(\frac{{@AB@}}{{@PQ@}} = \frac{{@letter1@}}{{@PR@}}\)

\(\quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad {@letter1@}=\frac{{@AB@}\times {@PR@}}{{@PQ@}}={@AC@} \) cm

Similary, \(\frac{AB}{PQ} = \frac{BC}{QR} \Rightarrow \) \(\frac{{@AB@}}{{@PQ@}} = \frac{{@BC@}}{{@letter2@}}\)

\(\quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad{@letter2@}=\frac{{@PQ@}\times {@BC@}}{{@AB@}}={@QR@} \) cm
